intro: Tium humistratum, commonly known as the lowland tium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Tium humistratum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and riverbanks.
